result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shad A. Krause

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Shad A. Krause in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Victim rights complied with.  Plea of no contest to disorderly conduct-domestic.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court dismisses and read in Case No. 15CM142.  Court finds defendant guilty in 15CM144 disorderly conduct-domestic.  Statement by Attorney Nocco.  Statement by defendant.  Court orders 30 days county jail with huber and good time to begin no later than October 5, 2016 at 4:30 pm; court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; letter of apology due within 10 days and preapproved by victim witness coordinator.  Defendant has no objection to the cash bonds in 15CM142 and 15CM144 being applied towards the costs.  The balance is to be paid by October 9, 2016.  - rt
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 9, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
Status conference on May 26, 2016 at 11:15 am.
Status conference on May 3, 2016 at 04:00 pm.
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Shad A. Krause in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco appearing specially.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of complaint, charges and penalties. Plea of not guilty to the charge.   Court orders a $150.00 cash bond and $250.00 signature bond; booking and no possession or consumption of alcohol.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 11:00 am. - rt

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol.

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol.
